definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: Historically, the elite government officials are generally people with bound volumes of the family tree.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上，官宦人家一般都是採用裝訂成冊的家譜。

sentences.english: He binds this book with leather.
This text main introduce the improvement of the binding machine to the Model CR2 glue.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要介紹了對CR2型膠圈裝訂機的改進。

sentences.english: But most of the small ring binder is unable to do this.
sentences.chinese: 但是大多數的小型裝訂機是做不到這點的。

sentences.english: Crimp spine on pages for permanent binding.
Crimp spine on pages for permanent binding.
After completing Accountable Document Status Report monthly, bind up it and keep it in the archives .
sentences.chinese: 每月完成控管文件情況報告後，裝訂成冊，存檔。

sentences.english: However, the term is generally used to refer to the binding of booklets by means of saddle stitch or side stitch.
sentences.chinese: 這個名詞一般指用騎馬訂或平訂方法作小冊子的裝訂。

sentences.english: It is often used by stit chers for projects like ornaments and doilies.
sentences.chinese: 它往往是項目使用如裝訂飾品和桌布。

sentences.english: The books were printed and bound in plastic.
sentences.chinese: 這些書用塑料印刷和裝訂。

sentences.english: For this kind of bookbinding methods, is a great deal.
sentences.chinese: 對於這一類的圖書裝訂方法有很多種，各有千秋。

sentences.english: The Gospel was one of three texts bound together in a codex, or ancient book.
sentences.chinese: 這本福音書是三份裝訂在一起的古書中的一份。

sentences.english: A polished stone tool used in bookbinding to burnish the edges of books after applying metal leaf.
sentences.chinese: 中義一種用來使裝訂上金屬葉的書背磨光的石材工具。

sentences.english: His employment is that of a bookbinder.
The unbound sheets of paper were piled up on the table.
sentences.chinese: 還沒有裝訂成冊的論文稿件堆放在桌子上。

sentences.english: Rubber, contrary to the common notion, is only for binding purposes.
sentences.chinese: 而橡膠本身，與大衆看法正相反，僅用於裝訂。

definition: to glue to/to paste onto/to stick on/also written 粘貼|粘贴[zhan1 tie1]
book format, similar to in-4°, in-8° etc (a 16-kai format 16開|16开[shi2 liu4 kai1] is roughly A4)/abbr. to 開|开[kai1]
to affix a seal/to stamp (a document)
